      yes

7.14.22  10:29 am   What is a tritone

     the relationship between the note C and the nearest F#. Or, between the note C# and the nearest G. or any two notes 3 whole steps apart.

     and how do I substitute it?

     "tri-tone substitution" would be like let's say if you have a normal song in the key of C, and you have that D7 chord, which famously contains the notes F# and C in the chord. If you lie around thinking about music for long enough you'll notice that you can play the F# and C notes in the chord, with the D bass note, and that gives you the D7 chord, but you can also put the bass on Ab instead and that gives you an Ab7 chord just the same. So a "tri-tone substitution" is when you use Ab7 instead of D7. (or A7 instead of Eb7. or Bb7 instead of E7. and so on). seems crazy but it just might work

7.14.22  3:10 am   If you were at a bus stop and the guy sitting next to you was a guy named "Will Burtz", what would you do?

      i might have a 9 digit number in my head that i'm working on prime-factoring, while waiting for the bus. it usually takes less time for the bus to arrive than it takes to prime-factor a 9 digit number. i usually don't know the names of other people at a bus stop, so that probably would not affect me

7.14.22  12:41 am   what's something you've learned recently?

      i might not be able to do very much foley in my upcoming non-song videos. i might just be using musical underscoring instead. which might actually be legit. at least it has been before

7.14.22  12:08 am   when somebody says something in outer space is x amount of lightyears away does that only describe its distance from us or does it mean the thing is so far away that we're seeing the past by the time the light is reflected back??

      both. lightyears is a distance. it's the distance that light would travel in that many years. the moon is just a few lightseconds away. that means it takes light a few seconds to get here from the moon

7.13.22  7:07 pm   when doing improvisations i tend to do many many crazy modulations and end up in a different place altogether. would you consider this something i should change?

     that depends how it sounds, and whether you like it

      Also do you recommend any jazzy chord structures used for filling up empty space or without any key in particular?

     that would be like recommening words to be used in sentences. that reminds me, i recommend the word "poit" for most sentences

      btw your nee song is fire, thank you for making jy life just a little happier

7.13.22  6:18 pm   Is Nebraska closer to Florida or to Washington? 

      normally i would expect washington (state). but the fact that you're askin this makes it obvious that it's meant to be a trick question where the answer is florida. so i was fairly confident that it's florida. but then i did some measurements and it seems to be washington (state)

7.13.22  12:54 pm   hey, bill. i have been a fan of yours for a while. your videos helped me thru the pandemic. was wondering what advice you give for people who want to make videos like yours?

      step 1 is find the export. wherever you are, figure out how to turn your project into a single video file. then work backwards from there. make the whole screen black. make the whole screen white. now you are in control

7.13.22  2:26 am   i was thinking about how unique your songs endings feels, how do you know when to just end the song where it does?

     it's the same way to know what happens next in a song. which i also don't know. at any time, when coming up with the next part of the song, ending it should always be one of the options. even at the beginning

      do you ever think about the song's length when you do?

     yes, but that hopefully shouldn't affect how the song is written

      if so, did you ever feel like 'padding' the rest of the song to make up for an early ending?

      no. padding is boring, i assume
